children.name: tight b1
children.definition: tight/taɪt/  tight clothes or shoes are only just big enough for you to wear, and they are often uncomfortable: chật, bó
examples: ▪ this skirt is far too tight.
▪ tight shoes can cause corns and other foot problems.
▪ i never wear tight clothes - i just don’t feel comfortable in them.

children.name: skintight x
children.definition: skintight/ˈskɪntaɪt/  skintight clothes are very tight and fit exactly to the shape of your body, especially in a way that looks sexually attractive:bó, chật
examples: ▪ suzy was wearing a sleeveless skintight dress and sandals.
suzy đã mặc một bộ váy bó hở tay và đi dép.
▪ a pair of skintight jeans
chiếc quần jean bó

children.name: close-fitting x
children.definition: tight-fitting/close-fitting/ˌtaɪt ˈfɪtɪŋ◂, ˌkləʊs ˈfɪtɪŋ◂/  tight-fitting or close-fitting clothes are deliberately made to be tight when they are worn: bó
examples: ▪ standing next to him was a small, thin woman in a close-fitting black suit.
▪ the diver’s wet suit should be tight-fitting, yet allow reasonable freedom of movement.

children.name: not fit closely to the body
voluminous x
children.definition: voluminous formal a voluminous piece of clothing is large and consists of a lot of cloth – often used humorously:lụng thụng, thùng thình
examples: her voluminous silk dress billowed out behind her.
a voluminous cloak

children.name: loose b1
children.definition: loose (of clothes) not fitting closely to the body: rộng, lỏng , thùng thình
examples: she wore a long, loose linen jacket.
in hot weather, loose cotton clothes are more comfortable.
the top fitted me, but the shorts were a little loose round the waist.
wear comfortable, loose clothing to your exercise class.

children.name: outsize x
children.definition: outsize made for people who are very large or fat:quá khổ, ngoại cỡ
examples: they specialize in outsize clothes.

children.name: baggy x
children.definition: baggy baggy clothes are designed to be big and loose and hide the real shape of your body:
examples: bill was wearing a polo shirt and baggy blue pants.
i like t-shirts as long as they’re really baggy.

children.name: loose-fitting x
children.definition: loose-fitting loose, especially in order to be comfortable:
examples: i wore loose-fitting clothes to protect me from the heat of the sun.
a kung fu suit should be loose-fitting, with buttons and a high collar.

children.name: shapeless x
children.definition: shapeless large and loose, and having no shape or style:dị hình, kì quái, quái gở
examples: he looked dirty and was wearing an ugly, shapeless suit.
helen’s hat was limp and shapeless from the rain.

children.name: when clothes are the right size
fit b1
children.partOfSpeech: [i or t not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: fit if clothes fit, they are the right size:vừa
examples: he’s put on so much weight that his clothes don’t fit any more.
do these shoes still fit you?
fit like a glovefit perfectly
the pants were a little tight at first, but after i wore them a few times, they fit like a glove.

children.name: be the right size a2
children.definition: be the right sizeđúng cỡ
examples: why don’t you try it on to see if it’s the right size?
they had the jacket i wanted and it was just the right size too.
be the right size forđúng cỡ cho
are you sure those shoes are the right size for bill?

children.name: be a good fit x
children.definition: be a good fit to fit very well and be comfortable to wear: vừa vặn
examples: the suit was a good fit, but i didn’t like the pattern.
i had to guess what size she was, but fortunately the dress was a good fit.

children.name: grow into x
children.definition: grow intosth if a child or young person grows into clothes, they grow big enough to be able to wear them:vừa khi lớn lên
examples: i know the sweater’s too big for jenny, but she’ll soon grow into it.

children.name: brief x
children.definition: brief (of clothes) short and cover only a small area of your body:ngắn
examples: she was wearing a rather brief skirt, as i recall.
a very brief bikini

children.name: knee-length x
children.definition: knee-length sth that is knee-length is long enough to reach the knee :dài đến đầu gối
examples: knee-length socks
a knee-length skirt

children.name: calf-length x
children.definition: calf-lengthdescribes clothing or boots that end at the middle point between the foot and the knee
examples: a calf-length skirt

children.name: when clothes are not the right size
not fit b1
children.partOfSpeech: [i or t not in progressive or passive]
children.definition: not fitkhông vừa
examples: if the boots don’t fit, we can return them tomorrow.
not fit sb
there was nothing wrong with the coat - we took it back to the shop because it didn’t fit her.

children.name: be too big a1
children.definition: be too big/small
examples: you can’t wear your father’s suit, it’s far too big.
i have to buy tim some new sandals. the ones he’s wearing are too small.
be too big/small for
those jeans must be two sizes too big for you.

children.name: not be the right size a2
children.definition: not be the right size
examples: i bought him a shirt, but it wasn’t the right size.
not be the right size for
that sweater won’t be the right size for him -- he’ll need an extra-large.

children.name: tight b1
children.definition: tight clothes that are tight are uncomfortable to wear because they are too small and press into your body:chật
examples: i don’t wear my black dress very much. it’s very tight around the waist.
if your shirt collar’s too tight, undo your top button.

children.name: can’t get into x
children.definition: can’t get into if you can’t get into a dress, skirt, trousers etc, you have difficulty putting them on because they are too small:không mặc vừa
examples: i put on five pounds over christmas and now i can’t get into these jeans.

children.name: off-the-peg x
children.definition: off-the-pegukoff-the-rackus off-the-peg clothes are made in standard sizes, not made especially to fit one person:may sẵn
examples: an off-the-peg suit
off-the-pegukoff-the-rackus [adv]
it was only a cheap suit, bought off-the-peg.

children.name: ready-to-wear x
children.definition: ready-to-wearold-fashioned(of clothes) made in standard sizes, not made specially to fit one person:may sẵn

children.name: loosen x
children.definition: loosen to make a piece of clothing looser, especially by unfastening it:nới lỏng
examples: bill loosened his tie and lit a cigarette.
loosen any tight clothing, and lay the patient on his side.
eric leaned back in his chair and loosened his belt.

children.name: let out x
children.definition: let out to make a piece of clothing looser by undoing the stitches and sewing it up again, so that it is a little bigger:nới lỏng ra
examples: let out sth/ let sth out
you’ll either have to let that skirt out or lose some weight.

children.name: close-fitting x
children.definition: close-fitting describes clothing that fits very tightly and show the shape of your body: bósát người
examples: never ride in cold weather with tight boots or shoes, nor close-fitting gloves.

children.name: skin-tight x
children.definition: skin-tight skin-tight clothes fit tightly against your body :bó sát người
examples: skin-tight jeans

children.name: fitted x
children.definition: fitted fitted clothes are designed so that they fit closely to sb’s body:
examples: a fitted black jacket.

children.name: fully-fashioned x
children.definition: fully-fashionedukfull-fashionedus describes clothes such as stockings and tights that are made so that they fit the body exactly :bó sát thân người

children.name: skinny x
children.definition: skinny fitting closely to the body:
examples: skinny jeans

children.name: slim fit x
children.definition: slim fit slim fit trousers, shirts, etc fit your body quite closely.

children.name: slinky x
children.definition: slinky(of women's clothes) made of delicate cloth and fitting the body closely in a way that is sexually attractive:bó sát
examples: a slinky black dress

children.name: ways of saying that clothes become looser
stretch b2
children.definition: stretch if clothes stretch or if you stretch them, they become looser and do not fit you properly any more:rộng ra, giãn ra
examples: i think this sweater must have stretched when i washed it.
‘can i borrow your boots?’ ‘no, you’ll stretch them.’

children.name: give x
children.definition: give if tight clothes or shoes give, they become looser after you have been wearing them:giãn ra
examples: don’t worry if swimsuits are tight - they always give a little.
these shoes should start to give after you’ve worn them for a few weeks.

children.name: made-to-measure x
children.definition: made-to-measure made-to-measure clothes, curtains etc are specially made to fit :may đo
examples: made-to-measure curtains

children.name: tailored x
children.definition: tailoreda piece of clothing that is tailored is made to fit very well by a tailor:may đo
examples: a tailored suit
